author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I added two experimental commits to my engine-getblobs-v2 branch which computes the cell proofs when we receive the transaction (both via the nw and rpc), so the proof is no longer computed when calling getBlobs. Pls test

author: agnxsh
content:
unfortunately most likely no one from Nimbus could be present tomorrow, I personally have a clashing call with the Nimbus team

for nimbus
here's my weekly update:

- worked on improving getBlobsV1 performing better handling in times of non 100% hit rate situations, empty responses and partial responses from the EL

- worked with sunnyside to test our current peerdas implementation to accomodate upto 24 blobs

- finished up on our independent column syncer, which can handle cases on cgc changing due to validator custody, will test asap, maybe today itself

- improved our peer pool and peer management for better conditional peer acquistion, as peers often keep getting disconnected in real time, thereby increasing the likelihood of finding useful peers while column syncing/ column req/resp

- still need some more work on validator custody, handling backfilling situations took most of our time

- started working on getBlobsV2, nothing very substantial yet

author: jtraglia
content:
An addition: it would be useful to talk about the beacon-API changes for Fulu. Pretty much the stuff in this thread: https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1355219344011038912

What changes should be made to `getBlobSidecars`? Should we add a new `getDataColumnSidecars` endpoint? For `getBlobSidecars`, do there need to be additional KZG library functions? eg `recoverCells` (no proofs), `cellsToBlob`, or maybe just `recoverBlob`?

author: nflaig
content: since there is plan to discuss api related topics, I am curious if it makes sense to finally consolidate `prepareBeaconProposer` and `registerValidator` as per https://github.com/ethereum/beacon-APIs/issues/435, as with validator custody we need another registration mechanism, or it the plan to just do it was part of`prepareBeaconCommitteeSubnet`? doesn't seem like the best separation of concerns to me
